apple.name: apple.n.01
apple.definition: fruit with red or yellow or green skin and sweet to tart crisp whitish flesh

fish.name: fish.n.01
fish.definition: any of various mostly cold-blooded aquatic vertebrates usually having scales and breathing through gills

baby.name: baby.n.01
baby.definition: a very young child (birth to 1 year) who has not yet begun to walk or talk

bear.name: bear.n.01
bear.definition: massive plantigrade carnivorous or omnivorous mammals with long shaggy coats and strong claws

beaver.name: beaver.n.07
beaver.definition: large semiaquatic rodent with webbed hind feet and a broad flat tail; construct complex dams and underwater lodges

bed.name: bed.n.01
bed.definition: a piece of furniture that provides a place to sleep

bee.name: bee.n.01
bee.definition: any of numerous hairy-bodied insects including social and solitary species

beetle.name: beetle.n.01
beetle.definition: insect having biting mouthparts and front wings modified to form horny covers overlying the membranous rear wings

bicycle.name: bicycle.n.01
bicycle.definition: a wheeled vehicle that has two wheels and is moved by foot pedals

bottle.name: bottle.n.01
bottle.definition: a glass or plastic vessel used for storing drinks or other liquids; typically cylindrical without handles and with a narrow neck that can be plugged or capped

bowl.name: bowl.n.01
bowl.definition: a round vessel that is open at the top; used chiefly for holding food or liquids

bridge.name: bridge.n.01
bridge.definition: a structure that allows people or vehicles to cross an obstacle such as a river or canal or railway etc.

bus.name: bus.n.01
bus.definition: a vehicle carrying many passengers; used for public transport

butterfly.name: butterfly.n.01
butterfly.definition: diurnal insect typically having a slender body with knobbed antennae and broad colorful wings

camel.name: camel.n.01
camel.definition: cud-chewing mammal used as a draft or saddle animal in desert regions

can.name: can.n.01
can.definition: airtight sealed metal container for food or drink or paint etc.

caterpillar.name: caterpillar.n.01
caterpillar.definition: a wormlike and often brightly colored and hairy or spiny larva of a butterfly or moth

cattle.name: cattle.n.01
cattle.definition: domesticated bovine animals as a group regardless of sex or age; ; ; - Bible

chair.name: chair.n.01
chair.definition: a seat for one person, with a support for the back

chimpanzee.name: chimpanzee.n.01
chimpanzee.definition: intelligent somewhat arboreal ape of equatorial African forests

clock.name: clock.n.01
clock.definition: a timepiece that shows the time of day

cloud.name: cloud.n.02
cloud.definition: a visible mass of water or ice particles suspended at a considerable altitude

cockroach.name: cockroach.n.01
cockroach.definition: any of numerous chiefly nocturnal insects; some are domestic pests

couch.name: sofa.n.01
couch.definition: an upholstered seat for more than one person

crab.name: crab.n.01
crab.definition: decapod having eyes on short stalks and a broad flattened carapace with a small abdomen folded under the thorax and pincers

crocodile.name: crocodile.n.01
crocodile.definition: large voracious aquatic reptile having a long snout with massive jaws and sharp teeth and a body covered with bony plates; of sluggish tropical waters

cup.name: cup.n.01
cup.definition: a small open container usually used for drinking; usually has a handle

dinosaur.name: dinosaur.n.01
dinosaur.definition: any of numerous extinct terrestrial reptiles of the Mesozoic era

dolphin.name: dolphinfish.n.02
dolphin.definition: large slender food and game fish widely distributed in warm seas (especially around Hawaii)

flatfish.name: flatfish.n.02
flatfish.definition: any of several families of fishes having flattened bodies that swim along the sea floor on one side of the body with both eyes on the upper side

forest.name: forest.n.01
forest.definition: the trees and other plants in a large densely wooded area

fox.name: fox.n.01
fox.definition: alert carnivorous mammal with pointed muzzle and ears and a bushy tail; most are predators that do not hunt in packs

hamster.name: hamster.n.01
hamster.definition: short-tailed Old World burrowing rodent with large cheek pouches

house.name: house.n.01
house.definition: a dwelling that serves as living quarters for one or more families

kangaroo.name: kangaroo.n.01
kangaroo.definition: any of several herbivorous leaping marsupials of Australia and New Guinea having large powerful hind legs and a long thick tail

keyboard.name: keyboard.n.01
keyboard.definition: device consisting of a set of keys on a piano or organ or typewriter or typesetting machine or computer or the like

lamp.name: lamp.n.01
lamp.definition: an artificial source of visible illumination

lawn_mower.name: lawn_mower.n.01
lawn_mower.definition: garden tool for mowing grass on lawns

leopard.name: leopard.n.02
leopard.definition: large feline of African and Asian forests usually having a tawny coat with black spots

lion.name: lion.n.01
lion.definition: large gregarious predatory feline of Africa and India having a tawny coat with a shaggy mane in the male

lizard.name: lizard.n.01
lizard.definition: relatively long-bodied reptile with usually two pairs of legs and a tapering tail

lobster.name: lobster.n.02
lobster.definition: any of several edible marine crustaceans of the families Homaridae and Nephropsidae and Palinuridae

man.name: man.n.01
man.definition: an adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman)

maple.name: maple.n.01
maple.definition: wood of any of various maple trees; especially the hard close-grained wood of the sugar maple; used especially for furniture and flooring

motorcycle.name: motorcycle.n.01
motorcycle.definition: a motor vehicle with two wheels and a strong frame

mountain.name: mountain.n.01
mountain.definition: a land mass that projects well above its surroundings; higher than a hill

mouse.name: mouse.n.01
mouse.definition: any of numerous small rodents typically resembling diminutive rats having pointed snouts and small ears on elongated bodies with slender usually hairless tails

mushroom.name: mushroom.n.03
mushroom.definition: any of various fleshy fungi of the subdivision Basidiomycota consisting of a cap at the end of a stem arising from an underground mycelium

oak_tree.name: oak.n.02
oak_tree.definition: a deciduous tree of the genus Quercus; has acorns and lobed leaves

orange.name: orange.n.01
orange.definition: round yellow to orange fruit of any of several citrus trees

orchid.name: orchid.n.01
orchid.definition: any of numerous plants of the orchid family usually having flowers of unusual shapes and beautiful colors

otter.name: otter.n.02
otter.definition: freshwater carnivorous mammal having webbed and clawed feet and dark brown fur

palm_tree.name: palm.n.03
palm_tree.definition: any plant of the family Palmae having an unbranched trunk crowned by large pinnate or palmate leaves

pear.name: pear.n.01
pear.definition: sweet juicy gritty-textured fruit available in many varieties

pickup_truck.name: pickup.n.01
pickup_truck.definition: a light truck with an open body and low sides and a tailboard

plain.name: plain.n.01
plain.definition: extensive tract of level open land

plate.name: plate.n.04
plate.definition: dish on which food is served or from which food is eaten

poppy.name: poppy.n.01
poppy.definition: annual or biennial or perennial herbs having showy flowers

porcupine.name: porcupine.n.01
porcupine.definition: relatively large rodents with sharp erectile bristles mingled with the fur

possum.name: opossum.n.02
possum.definition: nocturnal arboreal marsupial having a naked prehensile tail found from southern North America to northern South America

rabbit.name: rabbit.n.01
rabbit.definition: any of various burrowing animals of the family Leporidae having long ears and short tails; some domesticated and raised for pets or food

raccoon.name: raccoon.n.02
raccoon.definition: an omnivorous nocturnal mammal native to North America and Central America

ray.name: ray.n.07
ray.definition: cartilaginous fishes having horizontally flattened bodies and enlarged winglike pectoral fins with gills on the underside; most swim by moving the pectoral fins

road.name: road.n.01
road.definition: an open way (generally public) for travel or transportation

rocket.name: rocket.n.01
rocket.definition: any vehicle self-propelled by a rocket engine

rose.name: rose.n.01
rose.definition: any of many shrubs of the genus Rosa that bear roses

sea.name: sea.n.01
sea.definition: a division of an ocean or a large body of salt water partially enclosed by land

seal.name: seal.n.09
seal.definition: any of numerous marine mammals that come on shore to breed; chiefly of cold regions

shark.name: shark.n.01
shark.definition: any of numerous elongate mostly marine carnivorous fishes with heterocercal caudal fins and tough skin covered with small toothlike scales

shrew.name: shrew.n.02
shrew.definition: small mouselike mammal with a long snout; related to moles

skunk.name: skunk.n.04
skunk.definition: American musteline mammal typically ejecting an intensely malodorous fluid when startled; in some classifications put in a separate subfamily Mephitinae

skyscraper.name: skyscraper.n.01
skyscraper.definition: a very tall building with many stories

snail.name: snail.n.01
snail.definition: freshwater or marine or terrestrial gastropod mollusk usually having an external enclosing spiral shell

snake.name: snake.n.01
snake.definition: limbless scaly elongate reptile; some are venomous

spider.name: spider.n.01
spider.definition: predatory arachnid with eight legs, two poison fangs, two feelers, and usually two silk-spinning organs at the back end of the body; they spin silk to make cocoons for eggs or traps for prey

squirrel.name: squirrel.n.01
squirrel.definition: a kind of arboreal rodent having a long bushy tail

streetcar.name: streetcar.n.01
streetcar.definition: a wheeled vehicle that runs on rails and is propelled by electricity

sunflower.name: sunflower.n.01
sunflower.definition: any plant of the genus Helianthus having large flower heads with dark disk florets and showy yellow rays

sweet_pepper.name: sweet_pepper.n.01
sweet_pepper.definition: plant bearing large mild thick-walled usually bell-shaped fruits; the principal salad peppers

table.name: table.n.02
table.definition: a piece of furniture having a smooth flat top that is usually supported by one or more vertical legs

tank.name: tank.n.01
tank.definition: an enclosed armored military vehicle; has a cannon and moves on caterpillar treads

telephone.name: telephone.n.01
telephone.definition: electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds

television.name: television.n.01
television.definition: broadcasting visual images of stationary or moving objects; ;  - Ernie Kovacs

tiger.name: tiger.n.02
tiger.definition: large feline of forests in most of Asia having a tawny coat with black stripes; endangered

tractor.name: tractor.n.01
tractor.definition: a wheeled vehicle with large wheels; used in farming and other applications

train.name: train.n.01
train.definition: public transport provided by a line of railway cars coupled together and drawn by a locomotive

trout.name: trout.n.02
trout.definition: any of various game and food fishes of cool fresh waters mostly smaller than typical salmons

tulip.name: tulip.n.01
tulip.definition: any of numerous perennial bulbous herbs having linear or broadly lanceolate leaves and usually a single showy flower

turtle.name: turtleneck.n.01
turtle.definition: a sweater or jersey with a high close-fitting collar

wardrobe.name: wardrobe.n.01
wardrobe.definition: a tall piece of furniture that provides storage space for clothes; has a door and rails or hooks for hanging clothes

whale.name: whale.n.02
whale.definition: any of the larger cetacean mammals having a streamlined body and breathing through a blowhole on the head

willow_tree.name: willow.n.01
willow_tree.definition: any of numerous deciduous trees and shrubs of the genus Salix

wolf.name: wolf.n.01
wolf.definition: any of various predatory carnivorous canine mammals of North America and Eurasia that usually hunt in packs

woman.name: woman.n.01
woman.definition: an adult female person (as opposed to a man)

worm.name: worm.n.01
worm.definition: any of numerous relatively small elongated soft-bodied animals especially of the phyla Annelida and Chaetognatha and Nematoda and Nemertea and Platyhelminthes; also many insect larvae
